main

Class DatabaseEmissary

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.DatabaseEmissary

  • public class DatabaseEmissary
extends java.lang.Object
    the main class whose instance will hold the current connection to the database and be able to perform certain tasks related to it
    Author:
    Paul-Reftu

        Parameters:
        dbDriver - the driver of our database
        connPath - the connection path for our DB (e.g "jdbc:sqlite:../database/faculty.db")

                   throws java.sql.SQLException
        establish a connection to the database given by the currently declared type

      • selectAllClassroomNames

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> selectAllClassroomNames()
                                                         throws java.sql.SQLException
        select all classroom names in our database
        Returns:
        the list of results w.r.t the query (i.e, all classrooms)
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - when the creation of the execution statement or the execution of the query itself fails

      • selectClassroomSchedule

        public java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.String>> selectClassroomSchedule(java.lang.String classroomName)
                                                                         throws java.sql.SQLException
        select all schedule entries related to the given classroom name (could return null in case that specific classroom does not exist in our DB)
        Parameters:
        classroomName - the name of the classroom whose schedule should be returned
        Returns:
        the list of results w.r.t the query (i.e, a set of tuples of the form (day, starting_time, ending_time, course_name), which are each stored in their own list)
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - on database access error

      • doesDbExist

        public boolean doesDbExist()
        checks whether the database at the currently-declared path exists
        Returns:
        true if the database specified by the current path exists; false otherwise

      • doDbTablesExist

        public boolean doDbTablesExist(java.util.List<java.lang.String> tableNameList)
                        throws java.sql.SQLException
        checks whether the given tables exist in our database
        Parameters:
        tableNameList - the list of the names of the tables to check whether they exist in our DB or not
        Returns:
        true if given tables exist, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - upon DB access failure

      • areDbTablesFilled

        public boolean areDbTablesFilled(java.util.List<java.lang.String> tableNameList)
                          throws java.sql.SQLException
        checks whether the given tables are empty
        Parameters:
        tableNameList - the list of the names of the tables to check whether they are filled w/ information
        Returns:
        true if the tables are filled, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - upon DB access failure

      • createTables

        public void createTables()
                  throws java.sql.SQLException
        creates the tables w.r.t the database
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - upon database access error or operation attempt through a closed connection
